Basic Explanation:
Your brain remembers the previous faces on your peripheral vision and when it sees a new face, it adds on to it. Hence you see the same somehow "silhouette"-ish structure of the face but as it changes, it adds detail on top of the "silhouette"-ish structure, making it look wierder and wierder.

Edit: See how it doesnt affect the person whose talking and that their face remain a bit ambiguous but normal looking.
